result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose F Guerrero Padilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 618 days.
Consecutive to: other count

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Register with the Sex Offender Registry.
No contact with any minor child.
Provide DNA sample if not yet previously done.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: other count

Defendant Jose F Guerrero Padilla in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing.   Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. State presents statements. Defense presents statements. Court imposed the following sentence: 

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

7 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 618 days)
  -  2 1/2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;  AS TO EACH COUNT, AND TO RUN CONSECUTIVE WITH EACH OTHER

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Register with the Sex Offender Registry
*No contact with any minor child
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
COURT COSTS:  $268 on each count (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);
  
Defendant is  not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is/ not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Per Judge Maxwell - Defendant to be held without bail pending sentencing.

Defendant Jose F Guerrero Padilla in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter, sworn. State is requesting adjournment request due to just receiving some letters from a witness that are written in spanish. Defense is objecting to the request and presents arguments. Court grants the state requests and will schedule a separate motion hearing before the trial. Defense counsel is requesting a Speedy Trial Demand. State has until 03/25/2016 to file any briefs, defense has until 04/08/2016 to respond. Court grants 1 thru 6 of the Motion in Limine and holds open #7 of the Motion.  Bail remains as fixed. Defendant Jose F Guerrero Padilla in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth for Donna Kuchler.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose F Guerrero Padilla in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Shawn N Woller and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Court addressed the issue as to the cell phone records that are suppose to be provided to the defense. Defense counsel is requesting the court sign a order to release the cell phone records for V.M. one of the victims. State stated that V.M. has no cell phone. Defense requests the court convene a hearing to have the girls and the detective appear in court. State objects and presents statements. Court sets this matter over for further proceedings in 30 days for the state and defense to figure this matter out regarding the cell phones. 15CF329 to tag along with this file.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.

Defendant Jose F Guerrero Padilla in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan sworn.

Case called for defendant's motion to disclose, motion to dismiss counts 2 and 3 and motion to sever count 4 .

Motion to Disclose:  Argument by Atty. Kuchler and Atty. Juech.  
Court will sign a subpoena if provided by Atty. Kuchler.  State to urge cooperation with individuals involved.  
State indicates they will have the police obtain cell phone and download contents of phone to review necessary information from 10-1-14 through present.  Information to be provided to the State and Defense.

Motion to Sever:  Argument by Atty. Kuchler and Atty. Juech.
Court orders Counts 1, 2 and 3 are severed from Count 4 for trial.  

Motion to Dismiss:  Argument by Atty. Kuchler and Atty. Juech.
Count denies the motion to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 for reasons stated on the record.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
